title: Winning doesnt even feel fun anymore
body:
The game has gone so far into Power creep and High damage that Everyone should be labeled an assassin because just one miss step and you basically get blown up by any champ, and this constant fear of one miss play has become so stressful that even when Winning i don't feel rewarded or awesome i just feel relived i get to breath.

honestly i rather have the tank meta back at this point because everyone 2 shotting everyone isn't fun anymore I really hate URF as the standard game mode.

replies.body:
Just starting the client feels stressful, I always hesitate for atleast 10 mins wether should I log in or not.
The amount of unfun to play against champions is more than the fun ones. Yes in the past there were some unfun champions but not this much. I guess removing all the runes and having nothing would make balance easier, since all the champions who are unfun are always abusing some kind of rune (ex: updated Dark Harvest)

They are trying to balance champions with runes but it will never work.

>Just starting the client feels stressful, I always hesitate for atleast 10 mins wether should I log in or not.

Just the fact that you still get on after this means you should stop because you addicted, have a friend uninstall it if you can't yourself

or they love the game but hate what Riot has done to it?

There's also burnout, which happens every now and again, but it typically does not cause the player to hesitate to play when they want to.

I play the Pokemon TCG Online every now and again...their balance is basically to balance out imbalance with even stronger imbalance, but that doesn't stop that it's fun to think of strategies and of course there's the rush of opening a new pack of cards that you worked for.

league has lots of new strategies to try, but at the same time, it does not seem like they are making much of an effort to fix the parts of the game that they break..

if he is in a burnout it's just another reason to take a break. 
The game is ever changing and its been like this since it came out 10ish years ago maybe he just doesn't like the direction the game is in, in which case he should take a break until the game does full circle to the parts in which he fell in love with.

I got For Honor on release, the game was a mess but i did enjoy the core mechanics of the game, most of the time the servers crashed and kicked me out, bugs were everywhere and the amount of grinding you had to do was absurd, but i could manage it because as a fan of history i loved the game, then season 2 came out and they released the new heroes cent and shinobi which were the most cancerous characters in the game, at which point i got so frustrated with the constant crashes and the bullshit of those two heroes, 1 only attacking you at range in a melee game and the other once he hit you with anything you just put the controller down and watch all you effort die alongside your character. The game was so stressfull to play especially while at the same time league was really cancerous for me as it was that awful ardent meta but i couldn't stop because i need to unlock more gear and the faction war was going on until a friend of mine saw my problem and just uninstalled the game so that i couldn't play it anymore. My grades went up, i was generally in a better mood and my life just seemed better. Fast forward to now i still play for honor from time to time as the game is much more enjoyable, and both those heroes are in the ground and i can actaully enjoy it and get the game i fell in love with.

All i'm saying is i know that feeling the guy has and that from experience the best way to deal with that problem would be to take a break until you've broken the addiction. You should never feel forced to do something you love
